{
  "statistical_functions": "import pandas as pd\nimport numpy as np\nimport scipy.stats as stats\nimport pingouin as pg\nfrom typing import Dict, Any, Optional, List, Tuple\nimport json\n\ndef _create_dataframe(data: List[Dict[str, Any]]) -> Optional[pd.DataFrame]:\n    \"\"\"\n    Helper function to parse analysis artifacts and create a pandas DataFrame.\n\n    Args:\n        data (List[Dict[str, Any]]): A list of analysis artifacts.\n\n    Returns:\n        Optional[pd.DataFrame]: A DataFrame with documents as rows and scores/metrics as columns, \n                                 or None if data is malformed.\n    \"\"\"\n    try:\n        # Find score and derived metrics artifacts\n        scores_artifact = next((item for item in data if item.get('step') == 'score_extraction'), None)\n        derived_artifact = next((item for item in data if item.get('step') == 'derived_metrics_generation'), None)\n\n        if not scores_artifact or not derived_artifact:\n            return None\n\n        # Safely parse the JSON strings\n        scores_list = json.loads(scores_artifact['scores_extraction'])\n        derived_list = json.loads(derived_artifact['derived_metrics'].split('## Execution Results:\\n\\n```json\\n')[1].replace('```', '').strip())\n\n        # Create dictionaries for easy lookup\n        scores_dict = {item['document_name']: item['scores'] for item in scores_list}\n        derived_dict = {item['document_name']: item['derived_metrics'] for item in derived_list}\n\n        # Combine the data\n        combined_data = []\n        all_doc_names = set(scores_dict.keys()) | set(derived_dict.keys())\n\n        for name in all_doc_names:\n            doc_scores = scores_dict.get(name, {})\n            doc_derived = derived_dict.get(name, {})\n\n            # Flatten the nested dictionaries\n            row = {'document_name': name}\n            for dim, values in doc_scores.items():\n                row[f'{dim}_score'] = values.get('raw_score')\n                row[f'{dim}_salience'] = values.get('salience')\n            \n            for metric, value in doc_derived.items():\n                row[metric] = value\n            \n            combined_data.append(row)\n\n        df = pd.DataFrame(combined_data)\n\n        # Add speaker information based on document name\n        speaker_map = {\n            \"The Ballot or the Bullet - Malcolm X\": \"Malcolm X\",\n            \"Letter from Birmingham Jail - Martin Luther King, Jr.\": \"Martin Luther King Jr.\"\n        }\n        df['speaker'] = df['document_name'].map(speaker_map)\n        \n        df = df.set_index('speaker')\n\n        return df\n\n    except (json.JSONDecodeError, KeyError, IndexError, AttributeError) as e:\n        # print(f\"Error creating DataFrame: {e}\")\n        return None\n\ndef calculate_descriptive_statistics(data: List[Dict[str, Any]]) -> Optional[Dict[str, Any]]:\n    \"\"\"\n    Presents a side-by-side comparison of scores for each speaker. \n    Given N=1 per group, standard descriptive statistics (mean, std) are not meaningful.\n    This function provides a direct comparative view, which is the most appropriate \n    descriptive analysis for this exploratory (Tier 3) case.\n\n    Args:\n        data (List[Dict[str, Any]]): The analysis artifacts.\n\n    Returns:\n        Optional[Dict[str, Any]]: A dictionary containing the transposed DataFrame for easy \n                                   JSON viewing, or None on error.\n    \"\"\"\n    df = _create_dataframe(data)\n    if df is None or df.empty:\n        return None\n\n    try:\n        # Select only numeric columns for description\n        numeric_df = df.select_dtypes(include=np.number)\n        # Transpose for a clean speaker-as-columns view\n        descriptive_table = numeric_df.transpose().to_dict()\n        \n        return {\n            \"description\": \"Side-by-side comparison of all CFF scores and metrics for each speaker.\",\n            \"comparative_scores\": descriptive_table\n        }\n    except Exception as e:\n        return {\"error\": str(e)}\n\ndef perform_comparative_analysis(data: List[Dict[str, Any]]) -> Optional[Dict[str, Any]]:\n    \"\"\"\n    Performs a Tier 3 exploratory comparison by calculating the raw difference in scores \n    between Martin Luther King Jr. and Malcolm X. With only one document per speaker, \n    calculating standard effect sizes like Cohen's d is not possible as within-group \n    variance is zero. The raw difference is the most direct and honest measure of effect.\n\n    A positive value indicates a higher score for Martin Luther King Jr.\n    A negative value indicates a higher score for Malcolm X.\n\n    Args:\n        data (List[Dict[str, Any]]): The analysis artifacts.\n\n    Returns:\n        Optional[Dict[str, Any]]: A dictionary of raw score differences, or None on error.\n    \"\"\"\n    df = _create_dataframe(data)\n    if df is None or df.empty or len(df) != 2:\n        return None\n\n    try:\n        numeric_df = df.select_dtypes(include=np.number)\n        mlk_scores = numeric_df.loc['Martin Luther King Jr.']\n        malcolm_x_scores = numeric_df.loc['Malcolm X']\n        \n        differences = (mlk_scores - malcolm_x_scores).to_dict()\n        \n        return {\n            \"description\": \"Raw difference in scores (Martin Luther King Jr. - Malcolm X). Positive values indicate MLK scored higher; negative values indicate Malcolm X scored higher.\",\n            \"score_differences\": differences\n        }\n    except (KeyError, Exception) as e:\n        return {\"error\": str(e)}\n\ndef perform_pattern_analysis(data: List[Dict[str, Any]]) -> Optional[Dict[str, Any]]:\n    \"\"\"\n    Performs a pattern analysis on the CFF dimensions using a correlation matrix.\n    \n    CAVEAT: With a sample size of N=2, any calculated correlation will be either \n    +1.0, -1.0, or undefined. This is a mathematical artifact and does NOT represent \n    a statistically significant relationship. This analysis is purely exploratory \n    to show the alignment of scores between the two specific documents in the corpus.\n\n    Args:\n        data (List[Dict[str, Any]]): The analysis artifacts.\n\n    Returns:\n        Optional[Dict[str, Any]]: A dictionary containing the correlation matrix, or None on error.\n    \"\"\"\n    df = _create_dataframe(data)\n    if df is None or df.empty or len(df) < 2:\n        return None\n\n    try:\n        numeric_df = df.select_dtypes(include=np.number)\n        # Clean data: drop columns with zero variance to avoid NaN correlations\n        numeric_df = numeric_df.loc[:, numeric_df.nunique() > 1]\n        \n        corr_matrix = numeric_df.corr(method='pearson')\n        # Convert to a nested dict for JSON serialization\n        corr_dict = corr_matrix.to_dict()\n        \n        return {\n            \"description\": \"Exploratory pattern analysis (correlation). WARNING: N=2 results in +/-1.0 correlations, a mathematical artifact, not a robust finding.\",\n            \"correlation_matrix\": corr_dict\n        }\n    except Exception as e:\n        return {\"error\": str(e)}\n\ndef calculate_reliability_analysis(data: List[Dict[str, Any]]) -> Optional[Dict[str, Any]]:\n    \"\"\"\n    Calculates Cronbach's alpha to assess the internal consistency of the 'cohesive' \n    and 'fragmentative' constructs as defined by the CFF.\n\n    CAVEAT: Reliability estimates with N=2 are highly unstable and should be \n    interpreted with extreme caution. This is a Tier 3 exploratory analysis to check if \n    the theorized constructs show any internal consistency within this small sample.\n\n    Args:\n        data (List[Dict[str, Any]]): The analysis artifacts.\n\n    Returns:\n        Optional[Dict[str, Any]]: A dictionary with Cronbach's alpha for each construct, or None on error.\n    \"\"\"\n    df = _create_dataframe(data)\n    if df is None or df.empty or len(df) < 2:\n        return None\n\n    try:\n        cohesive_dims = [\n            'individual_dignity_score', 'hope_score', 'compersion_score', \n            'amity_score', 'cohesive_goals_score'\n        ]\n        fragmentative_dims = [\n            'tribal_dominance_score', 'fear_score', 'envy_score', \n            'enmity_score', 'fragmentative_goals_score'\n        ]\n        \n        cohesive_df = df[cohesive_dims]\n        fragmentative_df = df[fragmentative_dims]\n\n        # Cronbach's alpha requires rows=subjects, columns=items\n        alpha_cohesive = pg.cronbach_alpha(data=cohesive_df)\n        alpha_fragmentative = pg.cronbach_alpha(data=fragmentative_df)\n\n        return {\n            \"description\": \"Exploratory reliability analysis for CFF constructs. WARNING: N=2 provides highly unstable estimates.\",\n            \"cohesive_construct_alpha\": {\n                \"alpha\": alpha_cohesive[0],\n                \"confidence_interval_95\": list(alpha_cohesive[1])\n            },\n            \"fragmentative_construct_alpha\": {\n                \"alpha\": alpha_fragmentative[0],\n                \"confidence_interval_95\": list(alpha_fragmentative[1])\n            }\n        }\n    except Exception as e:\n        return {\"error\": str(e)}\n\ndef perform_statistical_analysis(data: List[Dict[str, Any]]) -> Dict[str, Any]:\n    \"\"\"\n    Master function that executes all statistical analyses for the Tier 3 exploratory design.\n\n    Args:\n        data (List[Dict[str, Any]]): The analysis artifacts.\n\n    Returns:\n        Dict[str, Any]: A dictionary containing the results of all analyses.\n    \"\"\"\n    results = {\n        'descriptive_statistics': calculate_descriptive_statistics(data),\n        'comparative_analysis': perform_comparative_analysis(data),\n        'pattern_analysis': perform_pattern_analysis(data),\n        'reliability_analysis': calculate_reliability_analysis(data)\n    }\n    return results\n",
